DOC.brief_summary: To compare the effectiveness of cervical pessary (Arabin) and vaginal progesterone for preventing premature birth in twin pregnancies after IVF
DOC.brief_title: Cervical Pessary vs. Vaginal Progesterone for Preventing Premature Birth in IVF Twin Pregnancies
DOC.detailed_description: This is a randomized controlled trial. Women with twin pregnancies after IVF treatment, at 16-22 weeks of gestation, will be invited to participate into the study. Subjects meeting the study criteria will be randomized into two groups: (1) treated with cervical pessary (Arabin) or (2) treated with 400mg vaginal progesterone, once daily from 16-22 weeks to 36 6/7 weeks. Sample size: 520 participants
DOC.criteria: To be eligible for enrolment into this trial, each female subject must fulfil all of the following criteria at the start of enrolment, unless specified otherwise: Twin (mono or dichorionic) pregnancy. Cervical length (measured at 1622 weeks of gestation) < 38 mm. Willing to participate in the study To be eligible for enrolment in this study each subject must not meet any of the following criteria: Cervical cerclage in place . Stillbirth or major congenital abnormalities in any of the baby Twintwin transfusion syndrome Praevia placenta Severe vaginal discharge, Premature rupture of membranes Premature labor / Premature rupture of membrane Participate in another intervention trial
